data.headline: Weekend Brief: US equity futures edge higher as tariff escalation and trade-war fears dominate sentiment ahead of key economic data and Nvidia earnings
bullets: S&P 500 futures rose 0.7% to 6,909 and Nasdaq futures gained 0.9% following Friday’s relief rally.
Supreme Court rejected Trump’s IEEPA tariffs, but he pivoted to a new global levy under Section 122, raising the rate to 15% for up to 150 days starting Tuesday.
Renewed trade-war fears pressured US importers, retailers, trade-sensitive tech stocks (including Nvidia semis), autos, multinationals, exporters, and inflation-sensitive names.
Asian markets traded mixed amid confusion and concern over the US tariff escalation.
European markets ended the week modestly higher, supported by rare-earth supply deals benefiting US materials.
Oil prices climbed year-to-date on Iran-linked concerns, underpinning energy stocks like Exxon (XOM) and Chevron (CVX).
Bitcoin’s “$1T identity crisis” weighed on crypto-linked stocks such as Coinbase (COIN) and MicroStrategy (MSTR).
No major US corporate news over the weekend; traders are focused on tariffs, S&P Global Flash February PMIs at 9:45 a.m. ET, and a data-heavy week.
Key earnings to watch pre-market include Domino’s (DPZ), Axsome (AXSM), and Freshpet (FRPT), with Nvidia’s report and Big Tech policy scrutiny capping the week.
